If an objectContribution action throws a runtime exception in selectionChanged, the entire popup menu is ruined.  What seems to happen is that the last "good" menu is displayed for all objects.  For example, create an objectContribution for java.lang.Object using an action with a selectionChanged method like this:

    public void selectionChanged(IAction action, ISelection selection) {
    	this.selection = selection;
    	if (true) {
    		throw new NullPointerException("Sabatoge!");
    	}
    }

After the action is activated, this exception is thrown (Exception is below).  Click on various objects in package explorer and the same menu shows up regardless of what object types you select.  This is unexpected behavior and very confusing to end users, particularly in eclipse based products that are extended by third parties whose objectContribution actions are unknown and untested.  ObjectActionContributor should catch all runtime exceptions, perhaps throwable, and ignore bad actions.
